title: 114_hr1528
content: The Act may be cited as the "End Discriminatory State Taxes for Automobile Renters Act of 2015". It includes findings and a purpose section. Congress has enacted laws to prevent economic protectionism by State and local governments that discriminate against interstate commerce. In Gibbons v. Ogden, the Supreme Court affirmed Congress's sole right to regulate commerce between states under the dormant Commerce Clause. The purpose of the Act is to prohibit tax discrimination against motor vehicle rentals by State or Local governments in violation of the dormant Commerce Clause. Over 100 discriminatory taxes have been imposed since 1990. The Act aims to prohibit tax discrimination against motor vehicle rentals by State or Local governments in violation of the dormant Commerce Clause. The Act prohibits tax discrimination against motor vehicle rental property by State or Local governments. Chapter 805 of title 49, United States Code, is amended to include definitions related to assessment and commercial/industrial property. The Act prohibits discriminatory taxes on motor vehicle rental property by State or Local governments. Definitions related to commercial and industrial taxpayers and covered persons renting motor vehicles are included in the amendment to Chapter 805 of title 49, United States Code. The Act prohibits discriminatory taxes on motor vehicle rentals by State or Local governments based on rental rates compared to other tangible personal property rentals within the same area. The Act prohibits discriminatory taxes on motor vehicle rentals by State or Local governments based on rental rates compared to other tangible personal property rentals within the same area. Taxes on motor vehicle rentals must not exceed the generally applicable tax rate on at least 51 percent of commercial and industrial taxpayers within the State or Local jurisdiction to avoid discrimination. The Act prohibits discriminatory taxes on motor vehicle rental property by State or Local governments based on assessed value or tax rates compared to commercial and industrial property within the same jurisdiction. The Act defines terms such as 'Local' and 'Locality' as political subdivisions with tax authority, 'motor vehicle' as defined in section 13102(16), 'motor vehicle rental property' as property used for renting vehicles, and 'rental of motor vehicles' as exclusive use of a rented vehicle. The Act defines terms related to rental of motor vehicles, including the rental of tangible or personal property, the definition of a State, and the concept of taxes. The term 'tax' refers to any charge required by statute, regulation, or agreement to be paid to a State or Locality, excluding charges related to concession agreements at federally assisted airports or registration, licensing, or inspection of motor vehicles. The term 'tax base' is defined as the receipts. The term 'tax base' refers to the receipts, income, value, weight, or other measure of a tax to which the rate is applied. It can be determined by comparing the gross receipts of rentals of tangible personal property or other commercial and industrial taxpayers within a State or Locality. The text discusses discriminatory taxes on motor vehicle rentals and businesses, stating that they unreasonably burden and discriminate against interstate commerce. Such taxes are prohibited unless already imposed. The section allows for legal action by aggrieved individuals for violations of discriminatory tax laws on motor vehicle rentals and businesses. Relief granted by the court may involve striking the discriminatory portion of the tax. In legal action for discriminatory tax laws on motor vehicle rentals and businesses, burden of proof lies with covered persons to show tax violation. If violation is proven, State or Locality must prove tax equivalence to others. Other remedies are not limited by this section. The section does not imply Congress' consent to State or Local taxation prohibited without this section. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for chapter 805 of title 49, United States Code. Rules relating to State taxation on automobile rentals under chapter 805 of title 49, United States Code.
